comments: Fun fact. This track was originally called Suicide but the label pressured them to change it. If you shorten Suicide it becomes Sui so it's Chopped. Hence Chop Suey! That's why Serj says "we're rolling Suicide" just as the track starts on the album version. The more you know...

title: Mr. Brightside
comments: This song is a timeless classic, I don't think anyone will ever get bored of it .

title: Mr. Brightside
comments: This song is forever amazing, whoever is going through tough times I hope you can find peace and get through it..

title: Mr. Brightside
comments: When people say this songs makes people feel better people don‚Äôt realise that this was written after he found out he was being cheated on, so he made a draft that night and most of the lyrics weren‚Äôt changed as he wanted it to be as close to how he felt in that moment as he could, so at one of this legends lowest times he made a song that will be timeless and I have full respect and hope that this will never be forgotten

title: Mr. Brightside
comments: This song is easily one of the VERY BEST rock songs to come out in the years between 2000 and 2010. Straight up it really is!

title: Mr. Brightside
comments: One of my best friends passed away one year ago today. 19 years old when he died. We were on the high school swim team together and after every meet we would scream sing this song on the bus ride back. This reminds me of him more than I could imagine. I know I‚Äôll be coming back here often

title: Mr. Brightside
comments: It‚Äôs 1am, the 29 year old me can‚Äôt sleep but the 16 year old in me is reliving the glory of this song üò≥üôåüèª

title: Mr. Brightside
comments: if this song isn't playing at my funeral I'm not dying.

title: Mr. Brightside
comments: Almost 20 years on and still knocking around in the UK charts.

title: Mr. Brightside
comments: This is one of if not only songs that I will roll my windows down and sing at the top of my lungs, I've loved this song ever since I found it as a kid and now as an adult I love it even more.

title: Mr. Brightside
comments: A true masterpiece. A remnant from the time where music was neither classic nor modern.

title: Mr. Brightside
comments: One of the best overplayed songs ever that ACTUALLY deserves to be overplayed. Also, during the 2021 college football season, the Michigan Wolverines used this as their anthem from beating Ohio State for the first time since 2011 to winning their first B1G Championship Game ever (1st conference title since 2004 and first outright conference championship since 2003). It's a pretty cool anthem for a team like Michigan, but it's not the first song from the 2000s Big Blue made an anthem for them.

title: Mr. Brightside
comments: I'll never forget my first time listening to this song. Weird time in my life, starting to get older and see the world for what it really is, and also start to appreciate the earlier years a little more, and eventually I landed on this in the middle of the night. Idk how to really describe it, it was one of those moments where I find something and I'm just like "my god....how did I go this far in my life without listening to this?" The vibe and charm of this song will forever make it timeless, it's magical

title: Mr. Brightside
comments: This song hits at a party like no other.

title: Mr. Brightside
comments: Today's my birthday and I've had this song stuck in my head all morning!! This song brings back so many good memories

comments: "coming out of my cage and I've been doing just fine. Gotta be down cus I want it all" This line alone hits so hard, specially if you are socially awkward but trying to engage with others.

title: Mr. Brightside
comments: There's just something about this song that makes you want to listen to it over and over again. It's a timeless classic!

comments: This song makes me remember bad things that happened with a girl I nearly married. Regardless of what it makes me think about it‚Äôs a beautiful song and it really captures the pain someone feels in a situation where someone you love is loving someone else.

title: Kryptonite
comments:
REMASTERED IN HD!
Official video for "Kryptonite" by 3 Doors Down.

Watch more 3 Doors Down music videos:

title: Kryptonite
comments: Why can‚Äôt we have this type of music back again. I love it.

title: Kryptonite
comments: I think it's a crime that today is the first time I hear this song. Especially since I am 30 and I used to know all the bands from early 2000s. Wow bring me back to those times where the music was actually good. Not all that rap/pop crap we hear today full of cursing and promoting nasty things. People have dumbed down in the past 10 years.

title: Kryptonite
comments: If you are hearing this, you have an amazing taste in music. Hats off to you.

title: Kryptonite
comments:
Coming back to this after a decade and still gives me the same chills. Nothings changed. 

Youre my kryptonite!

title: Kryptonite
comments: This was a special song between my dad and me. He died last year Sept. 2. The day before his funeral, I drove to the cemetery to see exactly where the service would be the next day. (It‚Äôs a large military cemetery in St. Louis, Missouri.) As I drove in, this song came on the radio, and it felt like him finding a way to reach out to me. Not a day goes by that I don‚Äôt miss him.

title: Kryptonite
comments: Serious question: Why did this music just go away? Alternative rock from the 90s to around mid 2000s was amazing, and it just seemingly died overnight. People would still listen to music like this now.

title: Kryptonite
comments: I don't always listen to 3 Doors Down, but when I do, so do my neighbours.

title: Kryptonite
comments: For me, this song is a bittersweet memory: it always takes me back to being a young teenager, watching my grampie fade away with Louis body dementia, and my grammie, steadfast by his side, with unwavering love.  They taught me so much about love and life; 20 plus years later and I still think of them everyday.

title: Kryptonite
comments:
This song just doesn't get old and tired.
Love it!

title: Kryptonite
comments: My husband loved this song. Reminds me of my friend Rosemary. They are both gone now, I put this song on to remember good times we had, puts a smile on my heart.  Ô∏è

title: Kryptonite
comments: This song will always live on to me thanks to my grandma and her love for rock thankful to be brought up by such a good generationÔ∏è

title: Kryptonite
comments: This song is easily one of the greatest ever. Kept me alive when I was abandoned, now it has a new meaning to me now that I have 4 amazing kids

title: Kryptonite
comments: I gotta say, I miss having rock songs on the pop lists.

title: Kryptonite
comments: This is one of my favorite rock songs of all time. Can't help singing word for word everytime I hear it. Still sounds awesome in 2022.

title: Kryptonite
comments: This song reminds me of when I was a little girl. My mom used to play almost everyday. I love 3 doors down and that will never change. This song is my favorite for the rest of my life. I will be 3 doors down fan until I die.

title: Kryptonite
comments:
LYRICS: TO WHO DIND GET THE MESSAGE, YOU GET OLD, BUT THE HERO INSIDE OF YOU NEVER DIES, facing emergency you FIGHT



Well, I took a walk around the world

title: Kryptonite
comments:
Loved this song years ago, still love it now.

2022, and it‚Äôs still good.

title: Kryptonite
comments: Great song-my sister was the girl w the dreads in the alley. Sadly she passed away in 2011, but glad she got 2 b in this video

title: Kryptonite
comments: How is it possible to dislike this song?

title: Kryptonite
comments: Thank God for the 90's-2000's

title: Kryptonite
comments: Dang... 21 years later...  you can just feel this song..

title: Kryptonite
comments: Why can‚Äôt we have this type of music back again. I love it.

title: Kryptonite
comments: This song is still beautiful, after all these years. And the music video makes my heart swell and break at the same time.

title: Kryptonite
comments: This tune reminds me of the evening shifts at a job I had after school. Time flies.

title: Kryptonite
comments: This was my favorite song of all time when it came out when I was 3rd grade. Guess what? Still 100% checks out. Guitar work is so tight, emotion behind the vocals, I know straight up rock has not been popular for a long time and despite all of my hipster/indie leanings I will ALWAYS appreciate 3 Doors Down. I still think they're good.

title: Kryptonite
comments: This song is a straight masterpiece.

title: Kryptonite
comments: This song was playing during the first night of my first job ever as a dishwasher at a local restaurant.  I'll never forget it.

title: Kryptonite
comments: Although this song was released in 2000, it still reminds me of the end of the best decade EVER.  Best songs, best rave and party nights, super great time to be alive and Canadians were proud of who they were, the list goes on and on.  Sure, there were some bad things and struggles, but the energy from everyone was electric and f_cking fantastic.  Miss that decade SOOO much.

title: Kryptonite
comments: Perfeito Ô∏è

title: Kryptonite
comments: Me and my brother used to bang this song on the way to school , he passed away a few days ago, came back to remember the good old days , RIP my brother

title: Kryptonite
comments: I get goose bumps every time I hear this song. Favorite song all time!

title: Kryptonite
comments: Falta muito musicas assim hoje em dia

title: Kryptonite
comments: fun fact: when I play this, the people 3 doors down can hear it

title: Kryptonite
comments: In 2768 this will be considered classical music, a legendary song that only true legends listen to!!!

title: Kryptonite
comments: I just went to a concert and heard this live for the first time 2 days ago. Purely amazing and I can't believe how old this song is...i feel old

title: Kryptonite
comments:
11 years later, here I am again starting my day with you, my kryptonite <3
11 years of having this song in my life and lemme tell you, its been a blessing at times, soothing and repairing what has crawled through me like an arrow

title: Kryptonite
comments: It's been 21 years, my father used to listen this masterpiece when I was in my first grade, and after hearing many times I was fell in love with it and untill now it's one of fav, still vibin to this Ô∏è

title: Kryptonite
comments: A year ago, I was listening to this song on my computer when my friend called me with the news that our teammate had gotten into a horrible accident. As a teenager, that rocked my world. I was close with him- we were expecting that teammate to lead us as a captain through the hectic COVID sports season. I later found out that he had lost his leg and for weeks on end this song haunted me. No matter what I did, it continued to play in my head. I went on extremely long runs with it ringing through my ears; it‚Äôs what drove me to step up and take change in his absence.

title: Kryptonite
comments: I don't care what anyone says, this is one of the absolute coolest songs ever made.

title: Kryptonite
comments: this song brings back sooo many memories Ô∏è

title: Sugar, We're Goin Down
comments: I'm an old guy.  The last 10-15 years or so, I've been a bit underwhelmed by many music groups.  This was the first song I every heard by Fall Out Boy.  I immediately knew the young kids can still rock.  I'm now a huge fan of this group.  As long as young kids are making music like this...I have hope.  Great band.

title: Sugar, We're Goin Down
comments: Ahhh, yes. The Mid 2000's high school vibes. They used to play this on the various music video stations every single day before school(before YouTube). I was always more into metal like Killswitch Engage, Lamb of God, As I lay Dying, Trivium, Etc.. but something about fallout boy just caught my ear. So many Great memories (including some of my best friends) come to mind when I hear this song. It genuinely transports me back in time. Music is beautiful and powerful in that way. If you're reading this - I hope it does the same for you!

title: Sugar, We're Goin Down
comments: I'm a black mother who raised my kids in a mostly black neighborhood and my black punker son who's 28 and has always listened and prefer rock & heavy metal music since the age of 5 yrs old had gotten me hooked on Fall out boy and other rock and heavy metal music . I told him in spite of teens and my other 3 adult kids who were hip hop and R&B not to change who he was. I told him that just because you're black doesn't mean you have to like R&B and hip hop . Ppl respect the real you. At 22yrs later  he's still never had any problem in our mostly black neighborhood .Just thought I'd share something good. Be yourself. Support who your kids are as long as it's positive. Yes I rocked this song in my car hard for yrs üòÇüòÇ Have a safe good night everyone.

title: Sugar, We're Goin Down

title: Sugar, We're Goin Down
comments:
I still remember when this came out and it was the new, Fall Out Boy, because I picked up "Take This To Your Grave", when it came out, and was already a fan - I saw it at whatever store was before FYE...wasn't Sam Goody... but I grabbed it on a whim and it was a solid choice.
  This came out when I was 18. I'll never forget those days. I saw Fall Out Boy at Warped Tour 2005 (?, I am pretty sure it was that year) and it was insane, how many bands were at that festival...I'm replaying it in my head...remembering how damn thirsty, I was, all day and those crazy lines for water but also, that every good emo/pop-punk band was there. I walked behind, Andrew and his GF, after the FOB set, for about a minute and his shirt was off and you could see his back tattoos that he had gotten, semi-recently (I think he didn't have them during the TTTYG era, if I'm not mistaken).    Great times, can't go back but I'll be keeping the memories for as long as I can.

God bless you all and have an excellent day.

I just listened to this song again randomly and am reading people's stories and was just struck with a visceral physical heartbreak.  Realizing the passage of time.  Realizing that 2009 was 13 years ago... Knowing the friends I lost to suicide, addiction and the simple parting of ways that occurs naturally as characters who were irreplaceable suddenly are missing and irrelevant.  Love to anyone here, using music as a balm, as a doorway to another time, as a tether to the people you can't reach and a time you can only associate with by withering memory.  I make my own music now, and have for a long time... and I hope people will bond with it and over it in the way music has helped so many.  Be well ya'll.

title: I Miss You
comments: this song makes me so happy yet so sad‚Ä¶i‚Äôm flopping like a fish over here

title: I Miss You
comments: This song hits you harder when you're 35 compared to when you're 18. At least it does to me

title: I Miss You
comments: Eu e minha ex mulher escutando Blink. Melhor fase da minha vida. Eu fui imaturo, hoje me arrependo mas faz parte da vida. üò¢

title: I Miss You
comments: I read these comments and it‚Äôs like, we are a whole generation of kids that made it through. I feel like we were all connected, all friends through these songs and lyrics. I‚Äôm proud of us. We had some great music!

title: I Miss You
comments: These songs  comforted me when I was 16 changing schools again, and full of angst. I'm 31, and again I'm being comforted as I deal with extreme loneliness and heartbreak again.  Years have gone by but the music is always there to help.

title: I Miss You
comments: This is the one song I can sing from start to finish without missing a beat.

title: I Miss You
comments: For those who care yes it‚Äôs My grandson he  played these songs when he was alive he loved this group the picture is my grandson and my late husband they are laid to rest next to each other we played this at his funeral we have only got his memories and I am hear for his mother she is still distraught I‚Äôm 69 I listen to all his songs they help me feel near to him and I can be alone on here and hide my grief as I have other grandsons thank you for caring I‚Äôm not looking for sympathy It just helps me get through the pain I feel üôè

title: I Miss You
comments: I sang this song with my daughter playing the drums and my wife playing the guitar on Rock Band.  It will be forever in my memories.

title: I Miss You
comments: This song is a timeless classic, I don't think anyone will ever get bored of it.

title: I Miss You
comments: I was a huge blink fan growing up but by the time this album came out I had drifted away.  in my thirties now, I've come back to blink a fair amount, especially for Travis' playing and appreciating the musicianship.  I just listened to this song again randomly and am reading people's stories and was just struck with a visceral physical heartbreak.  Realizing the passage of time.  Realizing that 2009 was 13 years ago... Knowing the friends I lost to suicide, addiction and the simple parting of ways that occurs naturally as characters who were irreplaceable suddenly are missing and irrelevant.  Love to anyone here, using music as a balm, as a doorway to another time, as a tether to the people you can't reach and a time you can only associate with by withering memory.  I make my own music now, and have for a long time... and I hope people will bond with it and over it in the way music has helped so many.  Be well ya'll.

title: Dance, Dance
comments: For me the best song of this band

title: The Middle
comments:
REMASTERED IN HD!
Music video by Jimmy Eat World performing The Middle. (C) 2001 Interscope Records
#JimmyEatWorld #TheMiddle #Remastered #OfficialMusicVideo

title: The Middle
comments: A song so good it's time stamped into history as the good old days music. Rare to pull it off.

title: The Middle
comments: One of the most if not the most uplifting, reassuring songs ever made.  I can't count how many times this song pulled me out of a deep sad state.  Thank you for this.

title: The Middle
comments: Was crying from an anxiety attack so I listened to this. Still crying, but it's from relief now instead of anxiety. This song feels like it reaches into my heart and scoops out all the bad feelings. I won't say it cured my depression and anxiety, but it was definitely a puff of fresh air from the stifling emotions.

title: The Middle
comments: "It doesn't matter if you're good enough, for someone else" This is literally the greatest line, such a great saying to live by

title: The Middle
comments: This song made me realise, you can't get wrapped up in other people opinions of you. This song may sounds cheesy, but there is some divine revalation in this song, follow your true will and the universe will guide you and protect you.

title: The Middle
comments: This has to be one of the most uplifting, wholesome, and heartwarming songs of all time. Such a great message with such great music. Thanks for everything, Jimmy Eat World.

title: The Middle
comments:
I listened to this as a moody teenager not knowing what would happen in my life or where I would end up.
I listened to this a 21 year old in my first proper job as an adult not knowing what the heck I was doing.

title: The Middle
comments: I used to dislike this song in my teens- then I ended a long term relationship a few yrs ago and just now in 2022 thinking about my 40th birthday it brought me good vibes and positive thoughts... now one of my favorite songs after all that life has put me through- lost my kids in a custody battle in 2011, was homeless in 2012 as a result, broke up with the love of my life 5 yrs ago, and now, living alone and loving life after all it has given me... thank you for this!!!

title: The Middle
comments: It's October 2021, let's see how many people are listening to this masterpiece by this legend

title: The Middle
comments: EU AMO MUITO

title: The Middle
comments: 2022 still going strong as a damn amazing song I remember when it first came out

title: The Middle
comments: Love this!! Soundtrack to teenage years.

title: The Middle
comments: As someone born in 1996, I was literally raised with this song. You couldn't go anywhere in the 2000's and not hear this masterpiece.

title: The Middle
comments: I think this song finds you when you need it most.

title: The Middle
comments: If you wind up here in 2021, know this era was so awesome! Jimmy Eat World SLAPS!

title: The Middle
comments: i always come back to this song when i feel depressed, alone in the world and hopeless for the future. not saying it fixes everything but it is a comfort

title: The Middle
comments: After years of not having heard this song it just randomly popped in my head and boy am I glad it did.

title: The Middle
comments: This song will never be too old. I heard this song when i was 10 years old and ten years later, I still love this song with all my heart. Thank  you for this song

title: The Middle
comments:
That awkward moment when you‚Äôve been listening to this song for over 15 years 

.. and everything still isn‚Äôt alright..

title: The Middle
comments: This song is such a feel good masterpiece. It pulled me through some hard days, but also, kept my spirits up during very good moments. Thank you, from the bottom of my heart.

title: The Middle
comments: Don't worry guys. I'm still working on that time machine. I'll take us all home.

title: The Middle
comments: Seriously the best song too listen to when you're feeling down and out. I try to listen to it as much as I can because of my depression. It really does help keep the depression down imo.

title: The Middle
comments: This song has such a positive message and it really brings you up

title: The Middle
comments: One of the catchiest songs of all time. A 3 chord masterpiece. It's pop perfection.

title: The Middle
comments: 20 years later and this song still hitssss, heard it while I was cooking and my daughter was doing the guitar solo lol thanks Jimmy Ô∏èÔ∏èÔ∏è

title: The Middle
comments: Listened to this for the first time in years and got so pumped I started learning it on guitar. First solo I've ever learned.

title: The Middle
comments:
I saw this video when I was like 9 and I thought this was how all high school parties were gonna be like 

I was a very disappointed freshman

title: The Middle
comments: Everytime I hear this song I still get goosebumps and cry a little bit. This song means so much to me.

title: The Middle
comments: When I get really bad depression or anxiety. This song lifts my spirits sooo much.

title: The Middle
comments: Just a 17 year old kid, but this song was able to bring me out of a depressed state where I thought the world was against me and genuinely didn't want to be alive, I don't feel the best but I definitely feel better so I thank the world for this song being brought to my ears, (surprisingly on piano tiles)

title: The Middle
comments: Still sounding fresh nearly 20 years later. Top tune

title: The Middle
comments: One of my top 5 favorite songs. Catchy and easy to sing  great instrumentals great vocal 10/10

title: The Middle
comments: To this day this is still my favorite song. It never fails to make me feel better when I'm down:))

title: The Middle
comments: Just heard this on the radio literally 3 mins ago and loved it so I looked it up and favorited it. If u r watching this in 2022, ur a legend. Keep this song alive.

title: The Middle
comments:
[Verse 1]
Hey, don't write yourself off yet
It's only in your head, you feel left out
Or looked down on

title: The Middle
comments: This video is such an awesome representation of the song. The director nailed it.

title: The Middle
comments: This song kept me alive when I was younger and specifically in middle school. It‚Äôs been interesting to see how my emotional responses have changed to it as I‚Äôve gotten older. Now I‚Äôm so grateful I pushed through it all. Music really has the power to heal and save

title: The Middle
comments: This song changed so much for me when I was a awkward teen.    The lyrics. It hit me deeply and everything was alright. Now I am a grown ass woman and I am on top of the world. Thanks Jimmy Eat World.

title: The Middle
comments: Don't conform to what everyone else is doing if it's not you. Eventually you'll find someone who's right for you. Needed this video's message right now. Thank ya guys.

title: The Middle
comments: I‚Äôve heard this song MANY times over the past 20 years but felt truly encouraged for greatness after listening to it again.

Damn great song.

Damn great song.

title: The Diary of Jane - Single Version
comments:
15 years ago on this day, friends.     

Mind blowing how time continues to fly by.   Sadly, for me anyway, this album was the turning point when BB starting going south and slipping into over-produced radio rock territory.   Album has a few good songs such as this + the intro.  Topless was solid, but that was originally wrote sometime around their 1st album.    Which is a shame because Saturate and We Are Not Alone have both aged VERY well as alt-grunge offerings.  Just seems like most people only really appreciate Phobia and beyond when the gem of their work was the early times.

title: Welcome to the Black Parade

title: Welcome to the Black Parade

title: Welcome to the Black Parade
comments: 2019: THEY ARE BACK TOGETHER TIME TO GET MY EYELINER READY

title: Welcome to the Black Parade
comments: God, I remember when my dad had his thyroid cancer and everyday I would wake up wondering if today's the day he would leave this world. It was so fucking terrifying. I used to listen to this song to make me feel better. He's managed to make it, and I'm so fucking proud. He was fighting for so long, and it payed off. He was told he didn't have long, and yet here he is. I can't imagine what it would be like without him. It sounds fucking cringe, but I still look up to him like he's a superhero, even if he's not perfect.

title: Welcome to the Black Parade
comments:
There's a lot of heartfelt love for classic 70s-80s rock in this song. It exudes influences of Queen, Van Halen, The Police, GNR, maybe even a hint of Pink Floyd.
I'm 45 and a bit old for the emo years but MCR stands out for me as a band of that ilk that actually had impressive rock sensabilities.

title: Welcome to the Black Parade
comments: I... Honestly couldn't think of something to comment that would reflect how important these guys are to me. If I actually ever met any of them I would probably break down in tears. Their music is so influential, it can make my heart hurt, the guys themselves are all such beautiful humans with unbelievable imaginations and senses of humor. ILYSM Ray, Gerard, Mikey and Frank, from the bottom of the heart of someone's life you saved.

title: Welcome to the Black Parade

title: Welcome to the Black Parade

title: Welcome to the Black Parade

When this song came out, I couldn‚Äôt relate to my hurting friends, I get it now. I love you guys and the memories you laughed in. I hope we all live because becoming a skeleton hurts the kids that look up to us

title: Welcome to the Black Parade

title: Welcome to the Black Parade
comments: Man. What a legacy. MCR, if I was one of you guys, I would look back on this vid as a legitimate, mega notch in time. The production is brilliant, you all look kickass, the song is timeless - in fact, I reckon it gets better with age. We all get old but, no matter what happens, this exists and you should be proud to point at it and yell, "THAT'S ME!"

title: Welcome to the Black Parade

title: Welcome to the Black Parade

title: I'm Not Okay (I Promise)
comments: This music video came out when my dad was in the hospital, comatose, due to a stroke originating in his brain stem. He died within the week. I was enthralled with this song, and the video just made me more into it. I asked a friend‚Äôs mom to buy the cd for me at the store because it had the explicit sticker, and I was only 14 at the time. I went home and listened to the album over and over and over. I still listen to it this day, at 31. It has helped me for years to deal with death and loss and all the emotions that come with it. It is my comfort album. Thanks MCR for being the best therapy.

title: I'm Not Okay (I Promise)
comments:
The thing I always loved about this song is the catharsis.

There's something that, at my lowest point, I found comfort in for just being able to blast this song and admit, I'm not o-fuckin-kay. With defiance rather than self-pity, no apology to yourself or anyone else. Helped me recognize that I'm fucked up in my own right and maybe it's permanent and maybe it's not, but it's mine and I own it.

title: When You Were Young
comments: My boyfriend who passed away a few weeks ago sang this song  when we were at a bar doing karaoke one night. Since he sang it that night, I had been trying to figure out the name of it; I finally came across it tonight. The song has so much meaning to me. We were together for five years and were both young when he sung this song. Now I just watch the video of him in my phone when he sang this song that night at the bar,  wishing he was still alive, wishing that we could go back in time to when we were young. R.I.P. Chris, I'll always love you.

title: When You Were Young
comments: "Sometimes you close your eyes and see the place where you used to live" kills me every time

title: When You Were Young
comments: I remember this came out when I was 15. Going to secondary school with no care in the world. Now I'm fast approaching 30. I miss the simplicity of youth and this song is a reminder of that. Really hits hard.

title: When You Were Young
comments: I'm almost 32 years old and this song makes me remember when I was 19 playing guitar hero when I was still young and feel young. Now it's a different story wish I could go back in time.

title: When You Were Young
comments: This song hit differently when you finally understand the lyrics

comments: words cant express the emotions i feel when I listen to this song like its just such a good vibe. everyone is reminiscing to this song which is valid but I see it as one of those songs you would play while you're setting off for adventure or making major changes in your life

title: When You Were Young
comments: This song is amazing on its own, but I feel that once you watch the video you can't hear it the same way. It's quite gripping and very relatable to us, adults, who have, in fact felt the exact heartache this woman felt. Quite a story inside a song!

title: When You Were Young
comments: I loved this song at 21 years old and still love it at 36

title: When You Were Young
comments: Nostalgia is both an amazing and sad feeling. Still remember those days, looking out of the car window at night as my parents played this song. I miss being younger, I was so much more happy, confident, could actually talk to people without being awkward, I was rarely anxious and didn't care about politics. Listening to this feels like I'm back in those days.

title: When You Were Young
comments: This is one of my very favorites songs of The Killers, they just posted a bit of the song in their Instagram today, I had to listen to the whole music tho... I mean, it's not a song, it's so much more, everybody can relate to this, and every once in a little while we listen to it and reinterpret it in a whole new perspective. I just love it!

title: When You Were Young
comments: This song and video make me think about all the suffering we experience in our lives. I sit here wishing life could be easier for us, and remember that so many people in history have gone through worse pain than most of us can imagine. How lucky we are to be alive and feel sorry for ourselves.

title: The Pretender
comments: While everybody might be giving their condolences I want to give my thank you to the band for all the years that they have shown their music talent and I want to thank the family of Taylor Hawkins for keeping that man in a safe and healthy environment or as long as we all could and thank you so much to Dave for putting in so much effort into the Foo Fighters since day one. comments: My mother who passed away 11 years ago  (I'm now 19) Loved  Foo Fighters. She struggled with drugs and alcohol. But she was a beautiful woman. I couldn't have wish for a better mother. This was her favourite Foo Fighters song. Brings back memories. The good ones. Rest in peace Taylor Hawkings, my mother would've been devastated.

title: The Pretender
comments: Grew up with the Foos and always loved Taylor Hawkins as a drummer, singer, overall musician and as a person. Can't imagine what the Foos, their fans and family are going through right now. He added so much to the band. His groove, his energy, his backing vocals, his chemistry with Dave. Always gave 100% every show. Rest in peace Taylor Hawkins. You touched the hearts of and inspired so many people. Sad to see him go way too soon

title: It's Been Awhile
comments:
The official video for "It's Been Awhile" by Staind from their album 'Break The Cycle' - available now!

Pre-order/stream ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Been Awhile (Live‚Äù):

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: I'm telling you when you get older these songs aren't just "fun" to listen to anymore. They will creep up and hit right in the heart.

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: I'm in my 6th year clean from heroin & this song brings back sooo many memories of my struggle w/the beast. Anyone fighting addiction just know it's so worth the battle when you get to the other side. Keep fighting!

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: I was living on the streets of KC when this came out. Always brings back an emotional connection to that time. Homeless, divorced, alcoholic, high-school dropout. Forward 20 years I'm a nurse who just celebrated my 14th wedding anniversary with a kid in college going for her PhD in biology. 15 years clean.... "it's been a while"

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: There will never be an era with music like this again!

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: It's been awhile... since I shot dope, hated myself, tasted it N the back of my throat with my heartbeat. This song sure speaks 2 me @ the deepest levels & I thank God that "It's been awhile..."

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: As an addict of nearly 25 years who has lost love, liberty and seen the loss of life, all due to addiction this song is tremendously powerful to me and resonates like only a handful of songs ever have.

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: Once a wise man said, "when you're happy you enjoy the melody but, when you're broken you understand the lyrics"

title: It's Been Awhile
comments:
When I was trying to recover from cancer I heard this album and this song in particular and it helped me through that darkest time in my life. It's now 2021 and I have been cancer free for 20 years. 
God Bless Aaron Lewis!

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: Used to listen to this song withdrawaling from drugs praying to feel better will always be one of my favorites helped me through alot almost 2 years no opiates hope everyone reading this is winning

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: This song hits deep for those that really understand it. RIP my father its been 11 years still feels like yesterday.

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: Its good to hear these songs from my younger days. Makes me appreciate getting clean getting married and straightening up my life to be there for my kids.

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: When we were young we listen because of a pleasing melody and catchy sound. As adults we listen because it help's us cope with a life that's geared to kick our ass every single day.

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: My first born son died of heroin overdose after being clean for 18 months. This was one of his favorite songs during his sobriety. Thank you Aaron.

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: I listened to this song in my teenage and college years and just liked the sound. I'm 33 now, and my brother is an addict. I never realized until tonight when this song came to mind and I pulled it up to listen that it's about addiction. Reading the comments and listening to the song after so many years has me dripping tears. Thank you Staind and everyone who's commented about how this song has helped them.

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: Every time I hear this song I feel it deep in my heart. I'm a recovering addict and I've survived but some have not. I wish I could say I'm sorry to all that I've hurt through the years.

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: This song just pulls on my heart...a life full of addiction, loss...and finally getting clean...not everyone made it to where I am...

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: I hide this song in my soul knowing the feelings that will appear once it plays, but on rare occasion will let this masterpiece flow and bring them all back, doesn't help I heard my drunk parents listen to it nonstop on repeat while they destroyed my childhood. I still have so much love for this song as an adult.

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: I started my road to recovery recently. I know not many people will read this, but every day truly is a battle. Regardless of what substance becomes your high of choice, your darkest battles are fought in your soul. The worst truth of all is that you will never be truly free, only momentarily without chains on your hands. The happiest I ever was was when I was at my worst, and that will always be a testament to my shame for what I eventually became. I only valued me and in the end I nearly killed myself, and ultimately I wasn't who was being hurt the most. The people around me were.

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: I love this man ;) and voice !!!

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: i come here whenever i feel like i cant do it anymore and this song always reminds me of my son and that i have to keep trying for him... i hope i make it out of depression one day... its been a while since ive felt like myself...

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: One of my favorite things about this song are the comments from everyone on the personal demons they overcame. Keep fighting the good fight. Anything worthwhile doesn't come easy. God bless you.

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: I play this song to honor my dear sweet mother... She passed away two months ago after a long one year battle with severe end stage COPD,, lifes not the same without her or my grandmother, they both passed around the same time, rest easy to you two beautiful souls . I miss you both so fucking much.

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: This is one of those songs that NEVER gets old

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: Story of my life as an addict. 21 years sober, and I still have to listen. Always remember where you came from, and how you succeeded!

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: I love this song, it's always touched my soul. My little brother learned how to play this song just for me. ‚ù§Ô∏è I have a small recording of it that I cherish as I was so proud of him. Well today... We lost another amazing person to suicide. So as I sit here in my feelings... I must listen to this song a million times. Rest In Peace Dylan! You fought your addiction and won!! üôå I'm so proud of you for that! I wish I could have been there to help you, to fight your demons üò≠ if I only knew üò≠

title: It's Been Awhile
comments:
It's' been a while" since I ve heard this MEGA JAM !!!!!

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: If you‚Äôre listening to this song in 2021... you have a good taste in music.

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: Reminds me of my mom who battled drug addiction and sexual abuse. I know now why she loved this song. The lyrics hit harder the older you get. RIP mom.

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: I've been listening to song for over 10 years and it until recently that I truly understood what it meant.

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: Been a while since I heard this. One of those songs that gets under your skin

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: When I first quit drinking I hated myself so much, I couldn't stand to look in a mirror, talk to friends, I went to work and kept to myself. This was one of the songs that kept me away from the bottle. The best decision I've made.

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: I haven't heard this song in over a decade so to hear it as it if was new again was overwhelming. Forever music. Timeless forever relevant.

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: I love this band!!!

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: "I cannot blame this on my father‚Äù hits me hard. I‚Äôm a fook up and yeah, he did the best he could for me. Even tho he‚Äôs an alcoholic, I‚Äôve learned a lot from him.

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: I heard you and this song 20 years ago and I remember the feeling of hopelessness and determination you gave me with these lyrics. The desperation is still here but more as an afterthought of everything that has happened to me in the last 2 decades. I still keep coming back for your lyrics as a way of reminding myself who I was, who I turned into and who I still wish to be. God bless you Aaaron. You will never know how much inadvertently you influenced my thoughts.

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: I know this may sound crazy but this song helped me stay drug free after a breakup , I start to fall down the rabbit hole and this song has always found me

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: 2 years clean from heroin next month! I went from not caring if I wake up to being thankful I wake up each day. So proud of all of you that are going thru recovery with me! Y'all inspire me to keep pushing!

title: It's Been Awhile
comments: The older I get the more all these songs hit me, when I was a kid I just didn‚Äôt look at songs for what they are, as you get older and experience your own life you realise they were written for people like us,

title: Face Down
comments: This song was ahead of its time. It's so powerful and it talks about a really tough subject that no one wants to hear. I will always have a special place in my heart for this song. The things people go through are horrendous and it makes me happy to know that people actually care enough to voice their opinions and stand with those that can't stand for themselves.

title: Face Down
comments: I was born in the 70's, my teen years were 1980-1988. I thought the rock and metal i grew up with faded away, but Red Jumpsuit Aparatus, Yellowcard, etc renewed my faith. I listen to these guys more now than "my" music. I hope you don't mind an old metalhead hanging around!

title: Face Down
comments: I worked for a radio station when these guys were promoting "Face Down". They were on my show the day the lead singer of Boston died (Brad Delp). I was pleasantly surprised when the lead singer felt my pain that day. We talked about how "More Than A Feeling" was one of the best songs ever recorded. They were all really nice guys and I liked this song too. Yay Florida!

title: Face Down
comments: Years ago when I was in an abusive relationship, a supportive friend that lived in another country sent me this song. It eventually gave me the courage to get out. This song will always hold a special place in my heart.

title: Face Down
comments: I heard this song when I was 10 years old, and it brings tears to my eyes every time. My household never had domestic violence, so when I spent the night at my friends house and heard his step-dad beating his mom, I never felt so afraid in my life. What‚Äôs crazy is my friend wouldn‚Äôt even seem bothered by it üòï I played this song a lot and dreamed about standing up against his step dad one day. This song has changed so many lives ‚ù§Ô∏è forever in my heart

title: Face Down
comments: This song literally gave me the courage to confront my neighbor about his domestic abuse! I was threatened with eviction and harrasssed, but I didn't stop calling the police and reaching out to help the girl he was abusing! And in the end, she actually left him and thanked me for caring. It's the greatest thing to learn that you actually made a difference and helped someone! Never give up! And to all the scum bags in the world, WE SEE WHAT'S GOING ON AND WE WONT BE SILENT ABOUT IT!!!

Good times... One of the best moments of my life, thanks to this song. It's forever in my car song collection.

comments: Oh man this takes me back to when I was 10-11 years old... I remember hearing it and thinking it was the coolest thing ever but now that I'm 30 years old I realize how ahead of its time it was. I love the Foo Fighters, but more than that I love their humility. They never see themselves as bigger than anyone else, they involve the fans in their concerts, they share the love of music with the fans, and they are just down to earth guys. For a guy of my age who grew up in the 50's and 60's, it's refreshing. In the 1970's I played for the All Blacks, (you may need to research that), but staying humble when you are world famous is not easy for some. Fame can easily control you. But if you share your delight with your fans, you can't help but remain grounded.

Time for you to rock out the cosmos!
